user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_mv:
```c
int32 OS_mv(const char *src, const char *dest)
{
    int32 return_code;

    /* First try rename - this only works if it is on the same filesystem */
    return_code = OS_rename(src, dest);
    if (return_code != OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        return_code = OS_cp(src, dest);
        if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            OS_remove(src);
        }
    }

    return return_code;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
        {
            OS_remove(src);
        }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. The if-block is reachable when OS_rename fails and OS_cp returns OS_SUCCESS, so OS_remove(src) can be executed. There is no evidence in the fragment that OS_cp can never return OS_SUCCESS; only in the (not shown) case that OS_cp is provably incapable of returning OS_SUCCESS would the block become unreachable.
